cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 150 mi (240 km) ENE of Great Abaco Island, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-southwest tonight, then turning west-northwest on Wednesday and northwest to north on Thursday while crossing the northwest Bahamas and making landfall along Florida’s east-central coast before moving inland over central/northern Florida and into southern Georgia.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: East-central Florida coast (between Boca Raton and the Flagler/Volusia County line)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in the U.S. Virgin Islands; watches confined to Florida east coast and portions of the Bahamas.
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in the U.S. Virgin Islands; warnings confined to northwest Bahamas and Florida east coast.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwest Bahamas and Florida east coast from Boca Raton northward to near Altamaha Sound, GA.
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: GRAND EXUMA (Bahamas) – closest point listed in the wind-probability table
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected; only typical trade-wind breezes.
weather_observation.rainfall: No heavy rainfall associated with Nicole expected.
